content: I think you're jumping too quickly here. That prompt is to verify that you have the authority to do this. Once entered, you are then prompted for whatever primary password you want. The prompt for Windows password does not happen again.

content:
That begging message isn't personal — EVERYBODY sees it. If it's bothering you go to Settings and the very first thing is a tick-box labelled When "Thunderbird launches, show the Start Page in the message area." Un-tick it.

If Thunderbird did somehow know you'd donated we'd probably have people screaming about having their privacy violated.
creator: ThePillenwerfer

content: Yes, the addressbook is separate from accounts. There is no need to change to a different profile if a new provider is the only reason. The new account can be added to the existing profile. My experience on this forum is that users sometimes cause more problems when copying profiles. If you do copy the profile, be sure to copy it when thunderbird is not running.
creator: davidsk

content: Kunt u iets specifieker zijn? Hebt u een probleem of wilt u een Word-document met Thunderbird verzenden?
creator: markh2

content: IMAP accounts are downloaded to computer for thunderbird access. So, they are on computer and also on server. If you delete from computer, IMAP's sync feature also removes from server. You can manage this somewhat by not storing content on computer, just headers. This URL may give some help: https://kb.mozillazine.org/IMAP:_advanced_account_configuration
creator: davidsk

content: I brought up ver 91, clicked to write message, clicked F9 to show contact list, highlighted a mailing list, clicked 'add to BCC' and it worked. If this used to work, maybe the addressbook is corrupted? I don't have any suggestions, but maybe others do.
